displaytitle: Annunciation and Partial Sketch of Figure
medium: Pen and brown ink with brown wash over graphite
creditline: Museum purchase, Laura P. Hall Memorial Fund and Fowler McCormick, Class of 1921, Fund
markings:
Stamp in black ink, lower left:  [lion inside circle with another circle around it with words] ARS ET LABOR SAMMLUNG L. ZATZKA [Lugt 2672]
Stamp, lower right: PM [in oval] [Lugt 3561]
inscribed: in black chalk or graphite, lower right: A14

titles.title: Annunciation and Partial Sketch of Figure

makers.displaymaker: formerly attributed to circle of Sebastián de Herrera Barnuevo, 1619 - 1671

texts.textentryhtml: Ludwig Zatzka, Vienna [Lugt 2672]; Mathias Polakovits, Paris and New York [Lugt 3561]

This drawing had an attribution to the circle of Sebastián Herrera Barnuevo (1619-1671), but according the Lisa A. Banner, "this drawing lacks the specificity and definition found in his drawings."

Adapted from: Lisa A. Banner, Spanish Drawings in the Princeton University Art Museum, (Princeton, NJ: Princeton University Art Museum, 2012).
texts.remarks: 2019-5-2; Adapted from: Lisa A. Banner, Spanish Drawings in the Princeton University Art Museum, (Princeton, NJ: Princeton University Art Museum, 2012).

bibliography.boilertext: "Acquisitions of the Princeton University Art Museum 2002," Record of the Princeton University Art Museum 62 (2003): p. 107-161.
bibliography.citation: "Acquisitions of the Princeton University Art Museum 2002," Record of the Princeton University Art Museum 62 (2003): p. 107-161., p. 118
